channel.title: So I has this computer
channel.description:
and it sucks. I'm getting my new one soon. I figured maybe I could sproose up this computer a little for someone I know. He plays a lot of older games, but only cause his computer his worse than mine, meaning it would be good if this one could play new ones properly. Anything I should do to it? Trying to avoid spending too much money.
Motherboard: [url=http://www.msicomputer.com/product/p_spec.asp?model=845PE_Max]MSI MS-6580[/url] CPU: [url=http://img31.imageshack.us/img31/7180/35972600.png]Intel Pentium 4 2.40GHz[/url] Memory: 2 Random 512mb DDR333 (PC2700) sticks HDD1: 90GB HDD2: 250GB GFX Card: [url=http://i28.tinypic.com/2my705u.png]ATI Radeon 9000[/url] PSU: 150W (I think, sticker is scratched)

item.title: So I has this computer
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:13, topic:293142”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=387344.msg2901696#msg2901696 date=1249564708]
get the 3.0 ghz p4, 3850 and a 400w psu (antec, corsair, thermaltake etc.)
[/quote]
If you get a 3Ghz P4 make sure it isnt a Prescott because they are as hot as fuck. However your motherboard probably would not support the last P4s so you’ll need a giant and silent cooler.

But really, imo I think you should just buy a completly new computer. That RAM is as slow as fuck.[/quote]
It would be Northwood, but I’ll just go with what chrisn2323 and xEnt said.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 09, 2009, 06:32:46 pm[/size][hr]Oh btw, the motherboard posted doesn’t have ACC support so there would be no chance of unlocking the other cores.

Read full topic

item.title: So I has this computer
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

chrisn2323:

get the 3.0 ghz p4, 3850 and a 400w psu (antec, corsair, thermaltake etc.)

If you get a 3Ghz P4 make sure it isnt a Prescott because they are as hot as fuck. However your motherboard probably would not support the last P4s so you’ll need a giant and silent cooler.

But really, imo I think you should just buy a completly new computer. That RAM is as slow as fuck.

Read full topic

item.title: So I has this computer
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:10, topic:293142”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=387344.msg2903033#msg2903033 date=1249642760]

Thought you could only unlock the new phenoms?
[/quote]phenoms are 3 & 4 cores, athlons are 2, the CPU i mentioned is an athlon II (same thing as a phenom without the 3/4th core)

I thought Anthlons were built as dual cores right off the bat? As where the Phenoms were built to be quad cores and they locked the cores.[/quote]
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athlon_II
correct

you would need this
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819103694

but i suggest this
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819103649

Read full topic

item.title: So I has this computer
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:5, topic:293142”]AMD Athlon II X2 240 Regor 2.8GHz 60$

ASUS M4A78 Plus AM3 80$

Crucial 4GB (2 x 2GB) Ram 45$

XFX GeForce 9800 GT 512MB (+ Free COD4 Game) 110$

Total 295$, with the ability to possibly unlock the 3 and 4th core on the CPU, free COD4 game and free delivery.

the current HDD is fine, search yours or his house for an old computer that has 250w+ PSU and use that. this will run all the latest games, and will last a good 5 years[/quote]
250 is way too small

Read full topic

Total 295$, with the ability to possibly unlock the 3 and 4th core on the CPU, free COD4 game and free delivery.

the current HDD is fine, search yours or his house for an old computer that has 250w+ PSU and use that. this will run all the latest games, and will last a good 5 years

item.title: So I has this computer
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

I guess my questions would be more along the lines of what to get and is it worth it on a single, old, core?
I was thinking SAPPHIRE’s 1GB Radeon HD 3850, but will my CPU bottleneck with it? Is 3.0GHz P4 really worth it? etc.

Read full topic

item.title: So I has this computer
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

and it sucks. I’m getting my new one soon. I figured maybe I could sproose up this computer a little for someone I know. He plays a lot of older games, but only cause his computer his worse than mine, meaning it would be good if this one could play new ones properly.
Anything I should do to it? Trying to avoid spending too much money.

Motherboard: MSI MS-6580
CPU: Intel Pentium 4 2.40GHz
Memory: 2 Random 512mb DDR333 (PC2700) sticks
HDD1: 90GB
HDD2: 250GB
GFX Card: ATI Radeon 9000
PSU: 150W (I think, sticker is scratched)
